intro: Borreria tenella var. pumila, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a shrub that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular red flowers that bloom throughout the year, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant flowers and hardy nature.
